title: How to Make an Indicator Using Hibiscus Petals

steps.headline: Remove the stigma, and detach the leaves, so as to have only the red petals remaining.
Put them in a container, and pour approximately 6ml of ethanol or surgical spirit; the latter works best.
Crush the petals using an appropriate implement, such as a mortar and pestle.
steps.description: Crush until all of the liquid has been extracted from the petals.

steps.headline: Filter the solution, and you have the reddish indicator ready.
View results in sunlight if possible.

tyn: 2 to 3 grams of dried hibiscus petals
Bunsen burner or a hot plate
1 tsp (5.6 g) of a chemical of your choice
